intro: Cathcartia integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leafed cathcartia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its broad, smooth, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, often blooming in late spring or early summer. Its growth habit is generally herbaceous, with a preference for moist, shaded environments in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cathcartia integrifolia is considered a species of conservation concern.
